meanings.definition: Involving or characterized by action or activity.
meanings.sent1: The enactive child loved to play outside and run around.
meanings.sent2: She had an enactive role in the school play, dancing and singing on stage.
meanings.sent3: The enactive puppy kept everyone entertained with its playful antics.
meanings.sent4: His enactive imagination painted vivid pictures of far-off lands.
meanings.sent5: The enactive volcano erupted with a loud boom, spewing lava into the sky.

meanings.definition: To make something happen or exist.
meanings.sent1: The magician enactive a rabbit out of an empty hat.
meanings.sent2: She enactive a beautiful garden in her backyard with hard work and dedication.
meanings.sent3: The chef enactive a delicious dish using only a few simple ingredients.
meanings.sent4: His words enactive a sense of peace and calm in the room.
meanings.sent5: The artist enactive a stunning masterpiece with just a few brushstrokes.
